summary_comment: Professor Chen is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and ability to make complex material accessible. Students praise his engaging teaching style and the practical, enjoyable nature of his courses, particularly highlighting his effectiveness in helping them improve. Despite the rigorous workload, his kindness and clear expectations make his classes valuable learning experiences.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chen is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making even challenging courses like 201 enjoyable and deeply educational. Students praise his kindness, fun teaching style, and effectiveness in helping them improve, though they note that preparation is essential.

Ratings.comment: I took three classes with him. loved how he teaches. I learned so much, and he is just truly amazing. 201 can be challenging if you are new to Chinese. 331 is so fun and practical. 334 is taught in English and many readings. I loved all three. He is in Wheaton, but he is leaving, so plz take his class now. he is my fav prof. Chen laoshi we love you
Chen Laoshi is very kind and really helps students improve. Be ready for lots of work though!
I've never taken an individual classroom track before, but Chen Laoshi made is really fun! Seriously, take his class. He is the voice of reason amidst the sea of bad professors.
Chen laoshi is the best! He grades about the same as all of the other Chinese TA's. He's really fun as long as students are prepared. Extremely nice.

summary_comment: Professor Miller is highly regarded for her caring nature and insightful teaching approach, making her classes both engaging and interesting. She emphasizes discussion and group projects, with minimal required reading and a very affordable textbook. Attendance and participation are crucial, as they significantly contribute to the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller is highly regarded for her caring nature and insightful teaching approach, making her classes engaging and interesting. She emphasizes participation and attendance, requires minimal textbook purchases, and encourages discussion and group projects.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Miller was such a sweeheart! She cares a lot about her students and always offers insightful feedback and discussion. Class is very discussion based and there are a few group projects. There is a bit of reading but she usually provides the material, I only had to purchase on book that was very cheap for the whole semester.

Dr. Miller was such a sweetheart! Class is very discussion based and there are a few group projects. Her class does require a book but it is super cheap and easy to access. Attendance is mandatory and the class is very interesting and she is a very thoughtful and insightful teacher.

Very very nice. The class was really interesting and engaging and Professor Miller always had thoughtful feedback. Participation and attendance are so so important though so don't take it if you can't be there (but it's a great class so I don't know why you wouldn't go!)
I loved professor Miller. She is very kind and understanding. You can tell she really cares about her students and the material she is teaching. 10/10 would recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Kim is known for her high standards and passion for her subject, but her classes are criticized for being overly demanding with a heavy workload and strict requirements. Students find her lectures informative and her intentions caring, but also note significant issues with communication, time management, and grading practices, making the classes challenging and less enjoyable for many.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim's teaching style is characterized by a heavy workload and strict standards, which some students find overwhelming and poorly managed. Despite being described as a caring and passionate instructor, her class structure and communication methods often lead to frustration and dissatisfaction among students.

Ratings.comment: Blatant lack of regard and empathy for students which is masked by politeness and professionalism. Insane load of work that makes this class feel like it should count for almost twice the credits it offers. She is a sweet person, but her kindness does not peek through at all in her profession. Would not recommend taking her courses.

Dr. Kim is so incredibly passionate about her field and is very understanding. Not only this but her lectures are genuinely informative. She's super nice, but is pretty strict about what she wants in an assignment and has high standards. Honestly, the only bad thing about this class is the amount of reading and writing, it's a LOT.

I do not recommend this class unless it is required for your major/minor. As someone who took 17 credit hours, this class felt like 10 of them. The workload was large and the reading assignments were too hefty to complete in a single night. Prof. Kim is a nice person but her class is not very enjoyable for those who are not passionate about arts.

Dr. Kim is a truly caring instructor, that wants her students to succeed more than anything. While the course has a heavy reading load, she is always open to communication, and is understanding of circumstances. She is an outstanding instructor that cares about the class material, and has plenty of availability outside of class for extra help.

- 2 essays every week
- bad communicator
- no specific explanation of the rubric for any assignments
- bad time management (always on a time crunch)
- very few graded assignments (others went in as complete/0)

I understand it was her first year, but her teaching/class style was extremely hard to follow. Every other day you have to write 500 word essay for 0 points and there's only 5 real grades for the semester, 4 of which are group assignments. Her grading was extremely flawed and unequal to all group members. She is not understanding or compassionate.

summary_comment: Professor Jorati is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and engaging lectures, which challenge students to think critically and question their assumptions. His classes are interactive, involving discussions based on readings and multiple writing assignments, and he is known for being approachable and funny. However, some students have criticized him for poor organization, lack of communication through Carmen, and inconsistent grading practices.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jorati is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and engaging lectures, which challenge students to think critically and question their assumptions. His classes are described as thought-provoking and enjoyable, with many students praising his approachability and the fun learning environment. However, some students found his teaching style disorganized and noted issues with communication and grading.

Ratings.comment: Jorati is a thoroughly learned man, with deep knowledge of History, Philosophy, and so much more. This course was so much more than a regular seminar and I felt I learned a lot!

Professor Jorati conducts thought provoking and fun lectures, and challenges the students to question their assumptions and learn to think differently. You can easily bag an A if you do the readings and take part in class discussions. Class discussions are a big part of this course

the worst class Ive taken at Ohio State. he did not use Carmen at all, was unresponsive to emails, lectures were all over the place. took nearly 2 months to grade our 2 page papers. you will have no idea what your grade is until final grades are posted in buckeylink. went to every class and still got a C
Prof Jorati is a wonderful lecturer and his lectures are thought provoking and fun. I had a great time in this class and learned a lot.

He is extremely knowledgeable about the topic, and almost anything around it. The lectures are more like discussions sessions based on readings, and there are a number of writing assignments. Oh and he is funny!

He is a great lecturer and really makes you think. You do the readings and show up in class to discuss the material, and it's a lot of fun! Prof. Jorati has a unique way of leading the discussion and make you think, and discover things on your own. He is also very approachable and easy to reach outside the classroom.

He wouldnt post anything on Carmen. If you come to class, good! If not, you wont know what to do for the next class!! Terribly disorganized and would answer questions vaguely. How can a professor be so disorganized?!

summary_comment: Professor Haring is widely regarded as one of the worst professors due to his ineffective teaching methods and challenging exams. Students find his study guides inadequate for a general education class and criticize him for ambiguous question wording. Additionally, he frequently assigns last-minute homework, further frustrating the students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Haring is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, known for overly difficult exams, inadequate study materials, last-minute homework assignments, and poorly worded questions. Students find his approach to teaching ineffective and frustrating.

Ratings.comment: Worst professor ever!  Does not comprehend that people want to do well. 64 question shortanswer/essay exam to be done in 90 minutes.  Study guides-not worthy of a GE class.  Gives homework due with 24 hour notice.  Horrible at wording questions!
